column4: Can I get all users to use the same kppp configuration?  I don't want to have to do it for every one.
it's a long time since I've used kppp, but it saves a config file in the home directory of the user. put it in all the users homes.
if you haven't created the users yet, do as Frogzoo says.
Do you know offhand what the file is called?  I don't see it in ~ or ~/.kde.
no, sorry. take a look in the home dir (ls -la).. or try using lsof when the app is running to see which files are open.
I really should have installed docs for kppp, eh?
Thanks for the help.  Found it in ~/.kde/share/config/kppprc.
great, now you need to put that file in each home directory. the easiest way is to copy it to /etc/skel (preserving the directory stricture)
The users do already exist.  I'll copy it to their homes and chown it.
yeah, that would work. remember to chown and chgrp.
Is there a good/standard place to store something like that?
